description:
This is a really fun place to visit in the city. Make sure you check their website to see what the theme is for the month because the menu changes. When my friends and I went, it was GOT themed and since we LOVE GOT, we had to go. 

I ordered the "Unburnt" which was a chorizo scramble served with tortillas, advocado slices, and roasted potatoes. The food was delicious and I ended up cleaning up my plate. 

My friends ordered a small pitcher of mimosa and they enjoyed visiting the fruit juice bar to add some flavor to their champagne. 

I don't think I'll return to this place because the city is a bit of a travel for me but I really enjoy the geeky concept behind the menu!
author: Carmen L.

description:
If I could give 0 stars I would. My friend had a reservation for her birthday and when we arrived on time, the waiter was so rude and told us they had an unexpected reservation of 30 people and therefore could not seat us or even serve us drinks!! Half of us flew out here to celebrate with her. So you had an unexpected party of 30 and you're just going to treat the party who actually had a reservation like total crap? That's so rude. 

so maybe they should change their name to reservations with unexpected benefits!
author: Camila V.

description:
We hit this place up while they were doing a brunch pop-up this past weekend; first time I've experienced this and I loved the concept. They also do different themes from week to week, this weekend was Harry Potter. So fun! All of the menu items were themed around this and scrumptious! 

It was bummer we didn't get to try their normal menu but what we did order, was very good! 

Best part about this was the "build your own Bloody Mary" for only $11; that's a deal and really good to go with it. Tons of toppings and high quality vodka. Service wasn't the best after we got our food delivered but not bad enough where I wouldn't come back. 

All in all, great experience, great food, great weather and great drinks - about all you want in a Sunday fun day brunch!
author: Bethany M.

description: As brunch benedict craving tourists we wandered into this pop up unaware that they do themed pop ups regularly- very cool concept and the food was great. I'm a big seafood fan but honestly wasn't in love with the crawfish, could've been just that day or specific clump of it but it didn't taste very fresh. Aside from that the benedicts were filling & delicious! I especially enjoyed trying the "Bennie with Seoul" tempura chicken Benedict. Staff was very friendly, definitely recommend!
author: Amy G.

description: Good stuff! A nice handful of Benedict's to choose from, as well as other breakfast items. I did not have a mimosa but there was a mimosa bar with all sorts of toppings, seemed really interesting! We had to try the traditional Benedict, as well as the Florentina, and the Cajun one. All were excellent. So hard to find a place that prepares poached eggs properly, but Friends with Benedict's totally comes through. Only regret was not saving enough room to try the hot chocolate pancakes! Can't wait to return!
author: Jody G.

description: Quaint spot for brunch- great for groups as it wasn't too busy! The mimosa bar with various juices to mix was intriguing. Would go back again
author: Marissa R.

description: I love the idea of pop up restaurants, especially in a city like San Francisco where rent is just getting more ridiculous. It's like a way more delicious version of carpooling. My cousins go to Mayes fairly frequently, and were pleasantly surprised at how they were able to turn a crowded bar/club into a nice brunch spot. We easily made a reservation on their website and were seated within a few minutes. My cousin and her two year old are both vegan, and definitely appreciated that they had a vegan scramble on their menu. They gave little man some french fries on the house, which made his whole day! They didn't have the mimosa bar on the day that we visited, nor did they have a themed brunch, which was a little disappointing. I got a little excited reading other reviews because I LOVE Game of Thrones and Harry Potter, so I was looking forward to seeing what they had in store. The food more than made up for it though! I had the La Triveta benedict, which came with huge thick pieces of bacon and crawfish (I'm obviously not vegan). The eggs were perfectly poached, and the hollandaise was on point. The cocktail list also looked interesting, though we opted to go for the bottle of bubbly for mimosas! Four entrees and a bottle of champagne ran just under $100, which is pretty decent for San Francisco! I'll definitely check this out again next time I'm in the city.
author: Justine L.

description:
With brunching being such a competitive sport in SF, I randomly decided to try this pop up on Polk because C'MON earthlings how could you not dine at a place called FRIENDS WITH BENEDICTS????!?!!?!?!?! We're just all friends with benefits  ;)

This was nestled inside Maye's which is a grimy bar by night. It was great to see the dark dungeon transformed into a respectable brunch spot with live music and a vibrant morning dew atmosphere. 

I ordered the Classic Benedict because I had to go for the namesake here. Also leveraged my Yelp superpowers and was super resourceful to check in as to receive my free coffee. FOR THE GRATIS! WOOT!

The benedict itself wasn't anything that lit my world on fire but it was a solid benedict. The potatoes were sort of bland but nothing a little salt and hot sauce won't fix. Hot sauce always adds a touch of glitter to any dish.
author: Connie M.

description:
We had started our wait for brunch at Mama's down the street and after being told that the wait was going to be an hour and our tummies complaining I pulled out my trusty yelp app and this place popped up.  I didn't even peek at the menu because at that point what was more appealing was they were accepting reservations and the next one was only a 15 min wait!  Sold!

I think a lot of people had the same idea that we did because all of a sudden a crowd of brunchers armed with yelp descended onto this restaurant - what I was impressed with was the army of help the suddenly appeared to talk to the crowd, exit the tables that were ready to leave and get everyone seated in a pretty timely manner.  The menu was a "game of thrones" themed menu but right under that menu I could see a crab Benedict hidden away ....why oh why wasn't there a "Greyjoy" special that featured crab from the depths of the cold ocean (if you add this onto the menu please let me know - I'll make the drive up from Tracy just for this).

We ended up ordering a few dishes and two speciality cocktails - my Benedict was good and that beet flavored hollandaise was just amazing.  I ordered also a prickly pear jalapeño mimosa because they were out of the mango which I really wanted.  We were a party of 4 so one of our friends ordered what I did, another had a veggie scramble and finally a steak and bacon Benedict.  We finished our meals and cleaned up our plates.  The food was good to end up with 4 empty plates within 20 mins.  The service was good - take your order, drop off orders, check up on you - take a picture of the group and kept the h2o flowing.  

The restroom was clean for the most part - you could tell that the customers weren't very good at cleaning up after themselves, the space itself well furnished with both indoor and outdoor seating and all in all it was a fun experience and worth a repeat.
author: JOE M.

description:
I've been here quite often already and I just love coming back!

What's so special about this place/pop-up? Their ever-changing weekend themes! From their upcoming Game-of-Thrones theme, Summer of Love, etc... This is just a good fun place to be on a Saturday or Sunday morning!

If you're not in the mood for their original and themed breakfast, try some of their delicious regular eggs benedicts! The Trivet (with Crawfish Tails!) and the Wild Salmon are my favorites! So good. They also have a nice variety of different mimosas. The last one I tried was a lavender one. Pretty interesting.

The only downside with Friends with Benedicts is its "slower-than-average" service. It usually takes a while to get your food and drinks but the staff is super friendly! They also provide you with crayons to entertain yourself and to display your creativity to the world.

Lastly, they do take reservations which is always a plus for a brunch place in the City. If you can't make one, just come early to skip the lines!

One more thing, check-in with Yelp to get a free cup of coffee! You're welcome.
author: Alex L.

description:
Definitely can say I'm a fan. I've now been here twice, both times with the same friend. The first time was right around when the pop-up first started. Got the special on the first day, and a regular menu item on the second (although I regretted that immediately after I saw the special that my friend received!). Both times the food was tasty, and the service was good. This place has started to get very busy. I had about a 10ish minute wait for a table, which I thought was reasonable as I was still waiting for my friend anyways. But after we were seated, I noticed quite a large line forming at around 12.

Different tasty mimosas, where you can order up to a half pitcher (good for those casual brunch days). Also having paper table clothes + crayons is a fun way to kill time waiting for food. Last time I was there, my potatoes felt a little colder than the previous time so I'll chalk that one up to a mishap. Will be back for another themed adventure in the future. There's also a lot more signage up front compared to the first time that I went, so it's a lot harder to miss!
author: Rajeev S.

description:
Typical run-of-the-mill brunch place that serves solid brunch dishes with an emphasis on eggs Benedict and has a clever name.

Food: FWB serves typical brunch stuff: omelets, sausages, hash browns etc. But the highlight, as the name alludes to, is eggs Benedict. The portions are average. The price is very "SF", around 13-18$ for two poached eggs, english muffins, and a side of hash browns. My eggs Benedict was pretty good, but the hash browns were pretty bland and the entire dish was cold by the time I got it.
Service: The service was a bit slow but the staff was very friendly. As I said above, my food was cold by the time I got it.
Ambiance: FWB is located on Polk Street. It looks like FWB rents out some Greek establishment for the brunch crowd. The inside is spacious. All the tables and chairs are haphazardly positioned throughout the room. The furniture is pretty small. The table was covered by paper and had Crayons, which was pretty fun! 

I ordered:
Eggs Benedict with crawfish - Solid eggs Benedict with hash brown and crawfish.

Quantitative ratings:
Food: 3/5
Service: 3/5
Ambiance: 3/5
Value: 3/5
author: Sean W.

description:
Brunch is a competitive sport in SF. I'm an early riser and can make it to all the spots in time but my friends tend to be of a different breed. I was organizing brunch for a dozen people and I was nervous about my options.

Friends with Benedicts got my attention; what a creative name! They take reservations and this alleviated the anxiety I had about waiting with a group. They were super accommodating when I had to increase the number of people in my party a couple of times. When we arrived at 12:30, they were ready for us.

The server did a great job managing our drink and food requests. We had a liter of Classic Mimosa and a liter of Madeira (passionfruit with sparkling wine). Both were good and I don't think the Madeira was worth the extra cost over the Classic.

I ordered the Wild Salmon Benedict with fruit in lieu of hash browns and I was fairly satisfied with my choice. The salmon tasted great; my poached eggs were slightly overdone. They yokes were not solid but they were also not runny. My friend who ordered the exact same thing had better eggs. I would say that the food was good (but not that special). But what made this a 4 star experience was the easy reservation process. If you're looking for a centrally located brunch spot for a group, make some Friends with Benedicts!
author: Yi Z.

description: Didn't realize there were 2 of these locations. I finally understood the concept when we got seated. This particular location on Polk Street is inside of a dive bar (May's Oyster Bar). The food was seafood themed and the menus were Alice and Wonderland. My brother's gf enjoyed the mimosa bar and though my bloody mary was alright, the best drink by far was my bf's irish coffee. The benedict was great!
author: Maya L.

description: Love love loved it! Great menu selections, even greater Mimosa Bar! Service was quick and excellent, food was even better! The mimosa bar had 8 juice selections with plenty of various garnishes. Hats off to the pop up idea, we heard they should've there through the end of the year. Get it while it's worth it!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
So this one is a story.  

I tried to go two or three weeks ago.  I had read from the reviews that there wasn't a wait. We showed up around 11am for brunch thinking we would have plenty of time to make our 2pm show. But there was a line! Ok, our bad. It took 45 minutes to be seated - it's San Fransisco - we should have expected us. Once we were seated we ordered pretty quickly, but then our food kept not coming, and we realized that we really weren't going to be able to finish before our show started! So we asked to cancel our order. Fortunately they were super nice about it. They said they were so sorry and were way busier than they had ever been and to come back and next time it was on them...

So we did! This time success! To start, we were smarter.  We got there around 9:30/9:45 on a Sunday and did not have to wait for a table.

Our waiter was prompt in taking our order, and the food actually ended up coming out really quickly (almost too quickly), so clearly in the last couple of weeks they have done some reorganization to accommodate for more people.

I got the Salazar Benedict. The eggs were perfectly poached. The hollandaise was different.  I'm having a hard time explaining how - it almost tasted like it had nutritional yeast in it? (this is not a bad thing). It was not very lemony.  It was different.  The flank steak was delicious and the mushroom, tomato and bacon went awesome with it.  The English muffin was unimpressive. Not flavorful and got soggy. Suspecting it was previously frozen. Hash browns were standard.

My husband got the special Jambalaya with Eggs over rice. It was pretty good. Not too spicy.  I like the Benedict better, but it seemed solid. They do themed breakfasts along with their normal menu and it was from the theme.  

$5 - a great deal for a mimosa! With either orange or cranberry.  They serve it in a water glass which is a little funny, but it was plenty strong, so not complaining there.  They also have other cocktails.

I tried to order a decaf coffee and they said they didn't have decaf.  Which is kinda funny, because the first time I went they did.  It wasn't very good that time, so I guess I didn't really miss out on anything.  

I'm giving them 4 stars because I'm rooting for them to work out their kinks because I like their style.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Eggs Benedict are one of my favorite foods, so I was super excited and intrigued to check out this pop up brunch shop. A cheeky name and poached eggs...seemed right up my alley!

Came on a Sunday afternoon and was seated immediately which was shocking. Brunch on a Sunday at 12PM with no wait?! We gave credit to it being super bowl Sunday. My sister ordered the Salmon Benedict, her fiance the Salazar Benedict (steak), and I the Trivet Benedict (bacon & crawfish). To wash it all down we ordered the Bellini mimosa. 

When the benedicts first came to our table, there were a few mistakes. First, they brought a Florentine instead of the Salmon. This actually wasn't a huge deal, and they brought out the correct one shortly after. 

Second, they put beet hollandaise sauce on my Trivet Benedict when it was supposed to be just regular holldandaise. To an extent, I understood the mixup because accidents happen and every table was full so the kitchen was busy. However, what threw me off was when the server told me "there's the beet hollandaise in there but it tastes the same" while putting the plate in front of me. Unfortunately beets make me sick (and doesn't sound appetizing on bacon/crawfish, but that's just me), and I guess I would've just appreciated her asking if it was okay rather than just stating that it tastes the same because it left me feeling awkward when having to tell her that I couldn't have it. 

As for the actual Benedicts once they arrived correctly, I immediately admired the beautifully poached eggs. Unfortunately, the taste for all of them were just all right. Good, but not the best benedict I've ever had. 

All in all, I enjoyed my time at Friends With Benedict. Although their benedict wasn't drop-dead amazing, I still liked the environment and unique menu they serve which makes it worth checking out if you're into pop-ups. As for the server, aside from awkwardness and slightly flawed mix-ups, I also wanted to note that she was great otherwise!
author: Mars S.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Friendliness/Accommodations was 5 Stars, Food was 4 stars, and Execution was 3 Stars.

I love pop up concepts and this one was especially fun as they had a number of Benedicts offerings from their normal menu and they also offered a Netflix-themed menu and had creative options with ingredients and names that stemmed from shows exclusive on Netflix.

The service was super friendly and welcoming- they sat us down very quickly and served us water and our menus. We put in our orders as soon as we saw a huge party come thru the doors- but this is where they fell short. I think the kitchen staff is very understaffed (1 chef and 1 sous chef) for the size of the restaurant- they made multiple mistakes with our orders - quickly realizing their mistakes - and attempted to re-make them. The eggs benedicts all turned out quite fine but my side of potatoes - a rather simple side- was really undercooked.

The mimosas are a bargain but tasted ok - $13 for a half liter of a traditional mimosa (or $6/glass) or $18 for a half liter of the bellini (or $7-8/glass).

All in all - I would gladly return here because the concept is so fun and they have a lot of potential- I just think having been 1 month open - they still need to up their game a bit on executing. They plan to host pop-up brunches thru December 2017 on weekends so I look forward to coming back!
author: Veronica S.

description: Came here for brunch when we were in town.  Met some local friends at this pop up on Polk.  Breakfast was a GOT theme.  I order the King Slayer benedict which came with flank steak that was grilled a shade too much but was tasty nonetheless.  It was accompanied with mushrooms, tomato and arugula which was actually a great compliment.  Also came with hash browns that were middle of the road but still good.  Service was friendly, prompt and overall it was a pretty good experience with an interesting concept.
author: Basem T.

description:
Have been looking for a brunch place like this for a while. Good food, friendly staff, and a variety of (relatively healthy) options to choose from.

The atmosphere is more laid back than a lot of brunch places in SF that are super loud or have tables crammed very close together. We called on a Saturday around 11am for an 11:30 reservation for 3 and had no issue getting a table. The tables have paper tablecloths and crayons so you can enjoy coloring while you wait for your food :)

I enjoyed the Tofu Woo. It has tofu scrambled with a variety of veggies and quinoa. It's not extremely filling though, so if you are looking for a hearty brunch I would suggest ordering something else or getting an appetizer to go with it. My bf got the California Scramble and thought it was one of the best scrambled eggs he has ever had. I tried it and thought it had a good ratio of eggs to veggies.

They also had about 5 flavors of mimosas if you are looking for a drink with your brunch. I didn't try them this time but will have to another time!

Would definitely recommend Friends with Benedicts for brunch.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Super cute pop up in Mayes Bar. The food was good but not 5 star worthy. Plenty of space and relatively easy to get in.
author: Rabia H.

description:
Plus 1 star for coming during Game of Thrones theme week!

Pros
-make brunch reservation
-laid back atmosphere
-all the essential delicious brunch options
-theme week-game of thrones theme was so fun!

Cons
-slow service
-small individual sample creamers (can't think of the right term but I feel like they should have real creamer)

Overall totally down to come back!
author: Daniela J.

description:
If you read this and you're not sure about coming here - just grab your keys and DO IT! 

When I looked up places for breakfast I came across Friends with Benedicts and knew I had to come just because the name is on my top 3 list for best wordplays. 

First of all, the service is amazing: Chris is such a charming and attentive guy, making you feel welcome and right at home. Every table has a paper tablecloth and crayons, so while you wait you can scribble all over which is a childhood dream come true tbh. 

We ordered the classic and a Florentine and they were out of this hecking world!! The eggs were perfect, the sauce not too runny and the English muffins fluffy. 

It was so good in fact, that although we had planned to try another place, we came right back the next day after a long sleepless night thinking about those perfectly poached eggs!
author: Monia L.

description:
Solid food with nice service. 

Not at all crowded on a Saturday morning.

Nothing bad, but nothing special either.  This was in close proximity to my hotel.
author: Heather S.

description: Fun pop up with delicious brunch options. I got the Sweet Cakes off the LOTR menu. It came with 3 huge fluffy biscuits, but I wish there was more berries instead.
author: Janet Z.

description: Solid brunch. Came here after noon on Saturday and had no wait. Solid classic scramble and Benedict. French toast was a bit dry. Service was good overall
author: Dani T.

description: Interesting restaurant/pub that looks to be converted from an old hotel ballroom. It is an unconventional breakfast restaurant to be sure but it works well. They have a simple menu but they do breakfast right! I ordered the Salazar Benedict which was cooked perfectly, and included a nice thick cut of bacon as well as over-easy eggs and a piece of strip steak. The ensemble was quite delicious and I found myself licking egg yolk from my fingers after I finished. My GF ordered the Old Village omelet which she said was a pretty standard omelet. Slightly undercooked potatoes.
author: Victor W.

description:
I really wanted to like this pop-up! I think the concept is great and we need more places like this in the Polk neighborhood. Unfortunately the service was SO slow and apathetic, the coffee so cold, and my chicken panini so rubbery I was frustrated at having spent $14 for something that could have been so much better and cheaper had we gone to Jane on Larkin or Split up Polk Street. I also read on other reviews that the brunch was supposed to be themed, but I didn't see any kind of theme here. It was just regular tables with plastic tablecloth and a standard brunch menu...?

The waitstaff literally brought our food out and then took it back to the kitchen not knowing who was supposed to be served what. It almost felt like they had no experience with food service. Some people got their food 30 minutes before the rest of the table which made for even colder plates and some really hangry peeps!

Best part were the good mimosas provided by Mayes, hence the second star.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Came here for the high brunch reviews. Nice staff but disappointing food. 
-Blueberry mint mimosa was syrup mixed with sparking wine. Couldn't find the mint flavor. Desperately needed a garnish to liven up the presentation
-Poached eggs were hard-cooked for both me and my fiancé's bennys
-English muffin was best described as thin and slightly mushy

Positives: Great breakfast potatoes! Crisp and well-seasoned. Good coffee. Fun music. 

For a place claiming to specialize in eggs benedict, you expect them to nail it. For $16-18 per plate, they did not.
author: Claire P.

description: Great that they take reservations for brunch so you don't have to wait around (although we went on a Saturday at noon and it was empty . The food was just okay and got the brunch job done. I got the florentina benedict and was disappointed when it came out as raw spinach... not the best and definitely would have been better if it was sautéed. The hash browns were perfect. The service was not the best though--they really don't like you using the yelp checking offer lol
author: Sheena P.

description:
I'm actually really sad I have to down-grade my review. 

I came here again a couple weeks ago and it seemed like all the magic was drained this time. How did something so good go downhill so fast??

The theme is still the highlight for me, but maybe I realized my rose colored glasses were really fake solar eclipse glasses. 

Service: The first time I came, I had a great, attentive service. This time we were Caspers or something. No service at all. No refilled waters, no "how are you enjoying your meal" when your mouth is full, no lurking check ins. We actually had to get up to go to the counter to get our bill since no one was coming to our table even when we were imitating the wacky inflatable flailing arms display, staring at our waiter. 

Food: We both got scrambles this time and maybe this is where we went wrong. The tofu scramble was so incredibly bland. And I like bland things, but this was like on another level of bland. I kind of felt like I was wasting energy chewing and stomach real estate for something I wasn't getting much out of. The M-eat-er scramble had a couple over done, chewy pieces of cheap flank meat, some generic, GMO tasting sausage and bacon. Both scrambles came with a perfectly rectangle chunk of hash browns. 

We left $35 poorer and just as hungry when we walked in. 

At least Basik is a short walk away and was able to salvage our day.
author: Michelle W.

description: Minus one star for the over cooked poached eggs we got, other than that everything we ordered were up to par. Came here on a Saturday around 1:30pm, we waited for 20 minutes which was not bad at all. Their brunch have themed menus, this weekend's was Superhero themed. I got the Daredevil (Jalapeño shrimp eggs Benedict)and my bf got El Muerto (7hr braised pork with poached eggs) The food and service were definitely satisfying. They try to be prompt so you could be in and out. I would recommend to try this pop-up restaurant. It's inside Mykonos restaurants, ambiance is very casual.
author: Gwen M.

description:
smh friends w benedicts. i wasn't even attracted to those women they just... happened to be around n things led to other things. we'd hang out but when their friends mistook it for bf/gf that's the last they'd hear from me. every time. why was i so coldblooded.

owait we're talking about food?

%% plzzzz reprise the BREAKFAST CEREAL themed brunch ffffin legendary redo it i begs %%

(-_^) I'm Rick James, Brunch! $13
enoki alien chestbusta texture

(-_-) Shrimp, Shrimpmeister, Shrimpalaya Creole $15
shrimped out pimped out not simped out

tbh was hesitant to go bc nothing compares to brunch dishes composed of & coated in cartoon cereals from your childhood coughbringitbackcough. had fun tho.

online MENUS *aren't final* - expect more items on the actual paper menu.

dope MUSIC: sting & the police, journey, van ffffin halen, etc etc.

FOOD overall blandish was "ok" but awesome SERVICE and love the CREATIVITY in their themed menus. #themeonwayne #themeongarth
author: Dan B.

description:
Feel conflicted about leaving a not great review because they seemed like great people and concept is cute. However, execution was seriously lacking. 

Went for brunch around noon on a Sunday. Menu sounded delicious and their themed specials were extremely creative. Waited 35 minutes for a table which was fine but once we were seated it took an hour and 10 minutes to get our food. They did have butcher paper and crayons which was nice and amused us for the first 30 minutes. 

My sister ordered a breakfast sandwich off the special themed menu and it was delicious. The rest of us ordered scrambles and they were okay. Highlight was the perfectly crispy hash browns it came with. Overall, good but definitely not worth an almost two hour wait. 

The one bright spot was the server who was extremely friendly. He was horrified when he found out how long we waited, explained they were short a server and a cook and gave us a discount on the bill. They also closed the restaurant early when they realized how backed up they were so appreciate them trying to do the right thing but probably won't go back.
author: Sarina Y.

description:
i wanted brunch food so i came here with my boyfriend. we waited 15 minutes to be seated and over 45 minutes to get our food. i didn't eat breakfast so i was getting kind of impatient. it's nice that they had crayons and butcher paper on the table, so i was drawing while we were waiting for our food. i ordered the old village and my boyfriend ordered the florentina benedict. the old village was alright. the omelet wasn't amazing but the hashbrowns were delicious. i don't think it's worth the hour wait though. i would much rather go to new village cafe across the street and pay less for my meal if i had to wait the same amount of time.


notes: expect a long wait around 11AM-1PM on a saturday. make sure to snack beforehand or you'll be starving like us! not really recommended for large groups. the servers are really friendly. you can draw on the butcher paper while you wait for your food to come out!
author: Sylvia H.

description:
We came on a slow day. So we were seated immediately, the food was slow to come out considering we were the only guests at the time. However, the staff was super friendly. 
And it was a good time for me. Ask them for hash browns with cheese.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
I wanted to like it more but it was just kind of ok. Neat concept with friendly people so I hope they make it. It's a little weird to see so much Greek decor around but it's also sort of neat since it's a pop-up.

Classic Eggs Benedict with hash brown: Love the hollandaise sauce and the flavor was great with a little fresh chives on top.  The poached eggs were way overcooked which was ok for me because I don't like yolk anyway, but if you like your eggs poached perfectly so the yolk is golden and runny, then you won't like this.  The yolk was solid, like you could cut with a knife.  The hash brown was sort of just ok. It tasted like frozen hash brown heated up. But for me, the benedict was defined by the hollandaise, and I just like mine classic (no lemon, no orange, no funkiness in it) and they just do a nice creamy one.

Jambalaya: it's an interesting dish.  It tasted like some bites had no flavor and some bites just tasted like hot sauce.  Overall, it needed a little more flavor and the base was mushy. I'm not sure what they use as their base but it was super mushy. I wanted to like it more but the mushy texture was a real bummer.  I hope it was just cuz we were on the later end of breakfast but just be warned that it could be a real bowl of mush if you order it.

Pancakes: fluffy and light.  Tasty, but it definitely needs butter or syrup because the pancake itself doesn't have a ton of flavor.  One pancake was also burned on the bottom.  Kind of a bummer cuz you can just taste a lot of "burn" flavor.

Service: super friendly and helpful.  Great environment.  Unfortunately the food is just really slow to come out. They should really warn you that it's going to be a really slow meal but if you're in a rush this is not for you because it's really really slow.

I think if they weren't so friendly I'd give them fewer stars but the environment is a great casual breakfast pop up.  I'll probably try a few other breakfast spots before returning but I think it was still worth a try.

Opens until 2:30pm or until they run out of food.

Takes credit cards (via square swiped at your table)

Single sex single bathroom in the back.
author: Traci H.

description: We are not a pancake person but we loved the pancakes here. The customer service was okay but wish that they have more staff so we could have our service faster. We will come back.
author: Meichelle L.

description: The food was okay, but the service was horrible. Our waitress did not come back to check up on us besides when we got our food. We didn't get our toast until we were almost done with our food and it was not what we had asked for. They didn't listen to how we wanted our eggs cooked and they had charged us extra money for what was already included in the meal and our waitress had retaliated with us about it. We still paid in the end because we had to go, but I was not happy with this experience at all since this was my first pop-up restaurant.
author: Peter T.

description:
We came her with family during the heat wave. Only half our party had arrived and yet they still sat us down and began providing us with excellent service. Our son gobbled down their pancakes which were served with fruit and a sprinkle of confectioners sugar. I enjoyed the Trivet. Which was an eggs benedict with spinach and a scoop of crawfish tails. The brunch boozy drinks were a little overpriced but not enough for me to stay away.

Overall the experience was great and the food was delicious.
author: Trisha S.

description:
I didn't fully understand the concept of a pop-up restaurant until I I arrived there Saturday morning. The place is a Greek restaurant by weekday and a themed brunch spot by weekend. 

The theme this past weekend was super heroes, so I geared up with my Batman socks (capes included). I was disappointed that there was no one else in the restaurant dressed up other than our waitress.  

Pros:
- I felt like I was sitting in the restaurant from my big fat Greek wedding
- who doesn't love coloring on tables? 
- The jalapeño watermelon mimosa was light with a nice afterburn
- creative themed menu 

Cons
- super loud inside  
- drinks were expensive for how small they were
- waitress was super awkward and not very knowledgeable of the menu
author: Beth B.

description: Had the crab Benedict. Real fishy tasting. Not impressed. Bloody Mary taste like tomato juice, don't so it. And the Mimosa bar is not bottomless. Cool ambiance but the quality of food and drinks are not worth the price... in response to your response.... I feel bad writing it, but Benedict served with salty French fries? Just kinda felt like "bar food" brunch but paid almost $50 for mediocre food and drinks... expected more from a place with so many high reviews
author: Natalia D.

description: Food took forever to arrive, and then it was REALLY disappointing. Really bland, hastily put together Benedict's. I think most positive reviews here have either been bought or by friends/family of ppl who run it. Not recommended.
author: Dilan J.

description:
I had a great eggs Benedict Florentine. The eggs were cooked to perfection. Great idea for use of a restaurant that is closed at that time. Will definitely go again. Service was great. My son had the tejano scramble with fruit. 
Love the idea of weekend themed brunch!
author: Robin L.

description: Was doing a little staycation at the Scarlet Huntington and took the cable car down to Polk and checked Yelp reviews. Super unpretentious spot with excellent food. Eggs over medium were cooked, sausage delicious and coffee surprisingly good (which spoils trip to Saint Franks). Glad I ventured out of South Beach, need to do it more often!  Great service, too.
author: Robert M.

description: So fun!  Great food, open early. Thanks for wonderful service, Gabby!  Folks, a truly great Benedict.
author: Henry B.

description: I'm impressed with the service at this place, everybody was so nice, and food was delicious, they have a hollandaise sauce marinated in beets which gives a rich flavor to the egg Benedict's.
author: Zeidy O.

description: Quite possibly the absolute best benedict I've ever had. The eggs were cooked to perfection. The servers were very friendly, but didn't hover. I ordered the blueberry mint mimosa. It was a very generous serving. Delicious. I will be back. Often!
author: Matty B.

description:
I went to "Friends with Benedicts" on a Sunday morning around 12:30 for brunch and had a great time!

We liked:
- hot chocolate pancakes - highly recommended 
- Salazar Benedict (with steak and bacon) with a side of hash browns or fruit (we got the hash browns and were not disappointed). Come to think of it, we also got fruit too, so nice of them!
- eggs Benedict 
- French toast - really good as well
- crayons and table paper to draw on
- no wait on a Sunday morning!!
- service was amazing, everyone there was really nice

The wait was a bit longer than expected but they are still getting started and getting in their groove.

Our waiter says they will be there every weekend for a year (they just started last month) and they are going to pick up some weekdays for breakfast too. Good luck to y'all!
author: Karen S.

description:
I've been here twice for a weekend brunch. 

The first time I was happy with the food and interesting (good) choices for food options. I was excited to try their "Billionaire Bacon" appetizer but was told they ran out the day before. The service was poor (e.g. we didn't get water at our table until towards the end of our meal, even though I asked twice). Our server apologized profusely and deducted 10% off our meal. 

I thought I'd give it a second try, since I liked their benedicts options and wanted that bacon. But they took it off the list! Other items might've been removed too because the selection looked more ordinary. Waited forever for a server to take our order (I had to flag someone down). I tried to be creative by going with hot chocolate pancakes with marshmallows. The pancakes tasted good but no marshmallows. Also no utensils until we asked for them. Other things came up where I felt like I focused more on waiting for service than enjoying my time there. The mimosa bar looked great though, with a tantalizing selection of fruit options. Too bad they didn't offer anything similar with their juices (none were fresh squeezed). 

Overall the food was good (better the first time) but the service both times were poor.
author: Lainey S.

description: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. My party ordered a full bottle of mimosas and we took a seat at the bar waiting for our table to be set up. The waiter gave us our bottle and immediately gave us our bill. WE HAVENT EVEN OPEN THE BOTTLE YET. And we told the lady if she can bill us when WE GET OUR TABLE. And she said very rudely, "I already closed the tab". First time visiting San Fransico and first time at this horrible restaurant. DO NOT RECOMMEND.
author: Ana A.

description: The two servers were awesome! Food was good. Took a little while to get our food but we had a large group. So glad we were able to make reservations and it was actually pretty slow/quiet inside. It worked out perfectly for our friend reunion!
author: Megan E.

description: Went on one of the hottest days of the year, there was either no ac or it was broken. Every table seated after us had their order taken before us. Food was okay but the service was subpar.
author: Kristan B.

description:
Who knew a brunch place makes reservations! My friends and I came in around 10AM on a Saturday. The first thing they asked us when we came in: do you guys have a reservation? We said no but luckily there were still some tables for us to sit at. The restaurant's theme this day was Friends (TV show), quite rad. There were crayons on the table so we can draw on the table paper, and the waitress gave us a cup with Q&A related to Friends. We kind of played while waiting for our food, but the questions were hard. They have daily specials for brunch and all of them looked so appetizing. One of my friends and I shared their daily special benedict ($20 and coffee/tea is included), I forgot what it's called but it had mahi mahi, beets hollaindaise sauce, spinach, cheese, and hash brown bits on the side. OOO I liked it a lot! Not a strong beets taste, and everything just blended so well together. The presentation was great! Food was great! 

Con: service took forever, food took forever, and it's hard to get someone to notice us. The place is small so I would come early just to get a seat. 
Overall: pretty good food and impressive, well thought name.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Came to this restaurant based on the 4.4 star reviews google gave them.  Contrary to their reviews, this restaurant has a poor service and mediocre menu.  The hostess was very rude and the waiters seem not to care about the customers.  Not much of a selection for a restaurant that caters for breakfast or brunch.  For example, there  was only about 3 different options for omelette and they charge extra for side order such as sausage.
author: Emma d.

description:
First, they have paper tablecloths and crayons! 

Second, the food is super good and original. Croque divino was v delicious. Coconut rumcakes muy delicioso. Port royal mimosa, tre delicieux. Coffee, simpo delimpso. 

Third, it's priceless to find an unpretentious place like this in sf where you can get a good breakfast from good people.
author: Bobby R.

description: Fun idea but a bit over rated. Food was not good. Poached eggs were over cooked. Had high hopes for this pop up but unfortunately it under performed.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Not impressed

Came for brunch, ordered the special sausage and egg breakfast.

Took 40min for the food to arrive.

The food was mediocre, eggs and hash was bland. Sausage was ok.

Would not come back again.

They have paper on the tables and crayons for kids which keeps them occupied.
author: Alan A.

description:
Pros:
Crayons to draw while you wait!
Super friendly staff
Some dishes (like the choco pancakes) are cheaper than other brunch spots
No wait at 11AM on a Sunday!

Cons:
Similar to many Yelp reviews, it still seems like they're a bit disorganized in terms of how to handle demand. 3 hosts grabbed us when we first arrived and seemed to scramble. There also wasn't a great waiting area, so we were awkwardly in a relatively high traffic area without guidance or help.

It took about 20 mins (though filled with crayon drawings) to get the food.

$20 for a pork belly benedict is a bit much. Further, the pork belly was tough, hard to cut (even along the grain), and not that flavorful. The sauce and accompanying hash brown were good though. 

Unfortunately, I don't think we'll be back to try more with how relatively underwhelmed we were compared to some of the other nearby options that are excellent (Mymy, Olea).
author: Jeff N.

description: Fabulous breakfast spot with local fresh ingredients and excellent customer service! I ordered the Trivet Benedict and subbed the bread for a bed of spinach. It was delicious! Chris waited on us and was so accommodating to our dietary needs. Definitely can't wait to come back for one of their fun themed brunches. Highly recommend trying this place out!
author: Bethany J.

description: Amazing service and great food.. I tried the Texicano and my husband had the M-Eaters. Both were extremely delicious! We even drew on the table just for fun (construction paper covers). The staff was extremely friendly we will definitely be going back on our next visit to SF.
author: Arcie V.

description: Amazing food and service, I hope this place becomes more than just a pop up!! Next time I'm in town I'm def coming back!
author: Lenny M.

description:
Started with a rude waitress who rolled her eyes whenever we'd ask for anything. Once we got our food three out of the five orders were wrong. Forgot to bring hash browns with the order, and when fixing a mistake on another order brought it back still missing items. We got eggs Benedict and they were over cooked. Had to tell our waitress how rude she was being. Terrible service and food.


List of what was wrong: 
Hashbrowns were forgotten & had to ask for them to be brought out
Made omelet as a scramble and forgot avocado on that. Remade as omelet but forgot the pico - too fed up to ask for it 
our waitress didn't come to ask if our table if we needed anything except for one time, and when we didn't answer fast enough she rolled her eyes said "okaaaaay" and walked away :)
author: Kiana G.

description:
Ended up coming here after my roommate and his girlfriend came the day before. They were STOKED about it and wanted my girlfriend and I to join them the next day. Sure why not - probably just another brunch spot on Polk, classic. 

However, they were awesome. First, the food was really amazing - altogether we got a California Scramble, the Salazar, the Trivet and the Croque Divino. Everyone absolutely loved their food. The portions are big and hearty and delicious as hell. My roommate practically licked the plate.

On top of that the service was outstanding - they were continually checking in on us, the food came promptly and on top of all that they gave us free mimosas! My girlfriend ordered one and they came back with 2 options to see which she would want. Then they brought all of us free drinks and a carafe of mimosa on top of that. Definitely recommend coming here (also recommend calling ahead or making a reservation) and they will be opening a new location shortly  in North Beach - which I am sure will also be dope.

Also, our waiter chased after us when we left to thank us for coming in - that's a nice touch.
author: Conor V.

description: Good portion sizes, I like how they're not too big so that I don't overeat by massive amounts. No line when I went, which was a bit before rush time, but also didn't seem to have as much of a line during rush time either. Good place to have a solid brunch, especially in Nob hill where the line + food wait can be 2 hours.
author: Patricia P.

description: While visiting SF we'd heard of pop up restaurants and decided to give this a try. It was fantastic! Excellent menu - thoughtfully designed and delicious food! If we lived in the area, we'd be eating here a lot!
author: AC L.

description: I was immediately on board for brunch in Nob Hill with no wait time on a Saturday at 11:30! We had a friendly server who was attentive and great at refilling our coffee. They had a variety of benedicts, scrambles and other breakfast items. I got the smoked salmon and avocado toast, which I honestly wasn't blown away by. But my friend's scramble looked amazing. And I did really enjoy the hash browns and the blueberry pie pancakes that were on their special menu for the week. I'd like to come back and try one of their egg dishes and their hot chocolate pancakes!
author: Gloria N.

description:
I was looking for a new breakfast place after finding out that my previous "go to" place (New Village Cafe) went to "hell in a hand basket"!

I wasn't sure at first, but service was good, the food was good, and I liked that I was able to draw (I'm a kid at heart) on the butcher paper "table cloth" with crayons. 

I've been here twice now and found both visits I was left stuffed. I actually ate everything on my plate (I'd make my granny proud!). 

Come try out this place and see for yourself.  :)
author: Audrey S.

description: Today I wanted II feel like my mother come to my breakfast for me so I decided to go to friends with Benedict's pop-up located at 1431 Polk Street San Francisco California 94109 and I ended up having the most wonderful sake sandwich it had steak and Friday on top band mozzarella cheese onions and tomatoes sauteed and oh my mouth just watered every time I think about it my mother may have been gone for over 30 years but I can still remember her through the food that I eat at friends with Benedict's pop up thank God the place in my area
author: David D.

description: I had the classic Benedict but with bacon instead of ham added my husbands avocado from his Texicano cause he doesn't like avocado and it was BOMB!! They've only been open for a couple months and I can tell this place will be open for a long long time and hopefully will open one up in the Seattle area where we are from! My 6 yr old daughter had the hot cocoa pancakes and it was the first time she ate all her breakfast while on vacation here. Great service and friendly people. Good luck to them
author: Lauren R.

description: This place is really yummy. I got the Texas-ish omelet. The hash brown wasn't greasy and super crunchy which I loved. The omelet was filled with cheesy happiness meaning there's a lot of cheese.
author: Michael N.

description: Definitely recommend! Service is very good. Yelp deal for coffee is cool. And the food is sooo good. Got the Mearth From Earth's Surf and Turf. Makes me want more Benedict's! It's inside the Greek restaurant and opens on weekends unfortunately. Coming back when I'm in the area.
author: Joe A.

description: Our server, Gabby, was amazing, the life of brunch. I love this place! I ordered the Salazar eggs Benedict's and mimosas and was very impressed with the flavor and quality of ingredients. It's one of my favorite brunch spots in the city and will definitely be coming back again and again.
author: Sergio R.

description: Everything was awesome.  Loved the location and atmosphere. I am definitely coming back.  Food is out of this world and the watermelon jalapeño mimosa is great. Love love love this place!!!
author: Josie E.

description:
I've made sure not to miss a single weekend at Friends with Benedicts, including their two soft opens.

I was literally ecstatic to find out that Derrik and his amazing waitstaff were still in the neighborhood and hard at work with a new project, as I'd been missing them sorely on a weekly basis.

I highly recommend their benedicts, their croque madame, or any of their themed specials.The whole team is great and the food is awesome, trust that you're in good hands.

Welcome back guys, Polk street wouldn't be the same without you.
author: Austin M.

description:
Came here during my trip to San Francisco. We got the regular Pancakes and wild salmon benedict. The pancakes were just regular decent Pancakes (but I like the fact that it came with strawberries!) but the benedicts were pretty good. Blends very well with the salmon but it is little bit salty and sour cause of capers. The atmosphere of this place feels like country side restaurant. 

****** REALLY wish they close the door because we smelled weed/cigarettes often throughout our meal.
author: SuJun K.

description: Stopped in this morning for a breakfast and was really glad I did. I ordered the salmon Benedict and it was just as you'd expect, on an English muffin with eggs, salmon, capers and spinach. Also came with a delicious side of crispy hash browns. I felt really satisfied. They also have a salmon toast with avocado and I would try this next time. The coffee was free flowing and tasted good too. Really cute neighborhood spot. Give it a try.
author: Mariana Y.

description: Friendly staff, great location and the food was amazing!  Awesome themed brunch menus too - you can tell they put a lot of thought and care into these.  The only thing that would make this place better is if they had bottomless mimosas :)
author: Kyle B.

description:
Eggs Benedict are the best in town.
Regrettably pancakes weren't good at all - thin and sticky. Interior may need some rearrangement too
author: Denis Y.

description:
Brilliant and innovative!
Popped out of the Greek Restaurant and created a neighborhood breakfast joint every Saturday and Sunday. 
Hollandaise is perfection, speciality is the Benedicts, creative dynamic and absolutely wonderful service.
Im so happy they are back! Out with the "new" in with the friends.

Bravo and much successo.
author: Mark G.

description:
This place is awesome. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. I have been here a few times and the owners have gone out of the way to help us (including going across the street to get me chocolate milk when they didn't have any) 
I would recommend this place to friends.
author: Terry L.

description: One of the first brunches I had in the city! The service and food were okay. I'm not dying to go back, but it's a good concept splitting a restaurant.
author: Samantha M.

description: Amazing food, friendly service in a convenient location for locals and tourists! Highly recommend the smoked salmon Benedict! Finish with insanely good bread pudding!
author: Diane C.

description: Overprice in a bar smelled like alcohol from the previous night food was cold coffee was cold not worth it Wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy
author: Oscar L.

description:
Derek and the crew make brunch an amazing delight. Pop up brunch is such a creative and innovative concept. Derek is just the guy to perfect the idea.

We were thrilled to see a robust menu with all our favorites listed. We chose the traditional benedict and m-eaters scramble. Both were prepared perfectly. 

The team knows what the definition of food service is. Coffee cups never see the bottom, food served hot with all the right condiments.
author: Tammy P.

description: Was told to move for a party of 6 hues our party of two wasn't good enough.  Just left instead of being crammed in between others.  Also, we were told to seat ourselves 10 minutes before.
author: Jason M.

description: We are from South Dakota and found this place for breakfast on our last day of our awesome visit to San Francisco. It was the best breakfast we had on the whole trip. The owner and staff were really great and so was the food! As a plus you can color on the table while your breakfast is being made.
author: B A.

description: Cold food..underwhelming taste. Very good service but you arent missing anything...except maybe the mimosas lol
author: Tremaine H.

description: The best brunch spot I've been to...casual yet clean and comfortable. Some of the best service I've experience too!
author: Stephen J.

description: Super unique breakfast experience. Had a slow start to Sunday morning and checked yelp for a breakfast spot and found this spot. The owner Derek and staff were super friendly. The dishes felt very thought out. They were in a game of thrones theme when we attended which was very creative. I had the 2 eggs and toast item with a chorizo hash which was excellent. Highly recommend the chorizo hash. Whole party really enjoyed their meals and experience. Fun addition was the paper table cloths and crayons.
author: Alex A.

description:
Great concept with poor execution. The popup is inside a grimy and slightly dirty Greek diner. The silverware is stained and the tables and chairs are worn down with overuse. Servers are completely clueless. We stood in a line to get it for 12 mins. No not because it was full but because no one was there to greet or seat us. After getting seated the bumbling waiter finally took our order and forgot multiple times, coming back to confirm what we wanted twice. The food took forever to cone out. With a half empty restaurant, they were somehow backed up. 

Food was in a word GREASY. I got a scramble and hash browns all I could taste was cheap canola oil. So unappetizing. Companion got the salmon Benedict which he liked so that's where the two stars come in

We also got the bourbon French toast to share. This was super disappointing, it seems like they used cheap white bread that was doughy and disgusting. Everything was overpriced on top of it, My scramble was $14 and I got a tiny portion of eggs and those disgustingly greasy hashbrowns. 

I'd recommend this place go from pop up to pop out and get outta town. So many more worthwhile places!
author: Ella M.

description: Wednesday morning at 0730 and the place was empty. Food was amazing! Recommend the pancakes and needless to say the Benedict.
author: Matt J.

description:
Love the idea of a pop-up restaurant. I made a reservation through Yelp as well as emailing the restaurant, as I was planning on coming with a large group (10). While they were very friendly leading up to it, I don't think they were ready to handle such a large group. I overheard the hostess making comments to another patron about not wanting the large group to show up as I approached her to check the group in. 

Once we got seated, we waited about 15 minutes to place a drink order, then another 5 before we got water (and another 10 before coffee). They acknowledged they were busy, but smaller groups were getting in and out without us making any progress. The food was decent, but most options seemed like something I could make at home. 

I like the idea of the themed brunches and changing menus. Maybe it would be a better experience with a smaller group.
author: Emily M.

description: We went to Friends with Benedicts for the first time this past Sunday. We enjoyed the friendliness of the staff and delicious lunch of pancakes and mimosas. I can't wait to try out other menu items...our meal was simple but everything that came out to other tables looked amazing! Sure to be a regular weekend brunch stop for us every time we visit San Francisco!
author: Jean R.

description: Food is good, went on a Sunday afternoon and got seated rather quickly for 2 people. But not sure if we had an off day but our food took over 40 mins to get. Tables seated shortly before us were already done eating when we got our food. We ordered two entree with a coffee and an orange juice, our waiter had to reconfirm our drinks... he forgot 2 out of the 4 things we've ordered. Then FORGETS to bring it to us. There was a chance that we just had a bad waiter that forgot to put in our order or something.
author: Eliza C.

description: Wonderful! Owner and chef is very incentive and talented. One of the best Benedict! Looking forward to trying his other popups
author: Cambria H.

description: One of the best Benedicts I've ever had! The hollandaise  sauce was just perfect. Highly recommend this place.
author: Jacky C.

description:
Was really excited to try out a place dedicated to Benedicts  (at least in name), as they are my all time favorite brunch food.  Boy did I get my hopes up. First if all, after being seated and served coffee, we didn't see our waiter again for about 15 minutes.  When he does come back he asks us if we planning on ordering actual food.  Uhh.  You think I came here for coffee? 

So we finally put in our order. I got the Trivet, boyfriend got the special, Mike Tysons punch out Benedict (steak grilled tomato spinach).  We also got pancakes to split since they're 5 bux.   Why not.  

Well the restaurant wasn't really that busy for Easter Sunday brunch, but food still waited about 30 minutes for our food.  Got the eggs and they were basically hard boiled.  Not even remotely runny. For both of our benedicts. The English muffin was basically a piece of cardboard and I bent my utensils before giving up entirely. Bacon on my dish was chewy and undercooked. Pancakes were alright.  The best thing I had was the flank steak.from the special benedict.  That was well cooked.  I handed off my plate with most of the English muffins and an entire egg still on the plate, in all its hard yolked glory for the waiter to see when they picked it up.. not a peep.  Took it and trashed it and then another 30 minutes later, came back with the bill for $43.  

This place won't be getting my business again.  So disappointed. 

In their defense, and the reason for more than 1 star, is that I saw other tables with perfect poaches.  I don't believe in sending back food.  I hate to waste and my mom always made me finish my food, but I couldn't with this.  You get one chance to impress me.  And they didn't.  

Ye be warned
author: Adam S.

description: We had reservations but when we got there they were taking down the "friends with benedicts" sign (because this place is actually Mykonos Greek food) and told us they couldn't take anyone else. Sucks to find that out on 11am when you're hungry and everywhere else has a packed brunch line.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Very solid choice at a good price. The meals sound very simple but are made with good ingredients. Would highly recommend.
author: Emily K.

description:
Very average, could easily make better at home. Wait staff was attentive and very kind. Went on a Saturday for brunch, so the restaurant was bustling. 

Californian - Egg scramble was okay. Hash browns were under-seasoned and were sub-par due to their wet, non-crispiness.

Pancakes - Glad I didn't order these myself, just tasted a friends. Normally, I'm into sweet over salty for breakfast. If you are like me in this, skip the pancakes.
author: Danielle C.

description: Amazing food and great service. The eggs Benedict are always so delicious and creative. The menu is something you need to experience.
author: Rocio B.

description:
I love Friends With Benedicts! 

The food is delicious AND beautiful. I usually get the Florentina Benedict with Beet Hollandaise, but today I tried the Smoked Salmon Avocado Toast. Simply amazing. They also do a yummy basic breakfast and classic Benedict. 

The atmosphere is tops! Friendly people and crayons to draw on your table :-). A warm, welcoming feeling . 

This is a fun place to spend time with friends/groups. Weekend themes are generally hilarious; check out upcoming themes: friendswithbenedictspopup.com

I could go on...
author: Amanda P.

description: I ordered the Salazar Benedict from the regular menu.  Th egg was poached perfectly; I expected seeing a runny egg and I did!   Everything else like the mushrooms, flank steak, tomato, and bacon were all cooked perfectly.  It's a little bit pricey, but it is worth it because there is so much on the plate. I left the place with a full and satisfied stomach.
author: Kristie N.

description: Been meaning to try this as it sounded like one of the more unique brunch/breakfast options. All the staff is very nice and the presentation is super-charming. Overall, the food is relatively standard but solidly executed and decent portions. The drink prices are a bit high. Of course this is where places make their margins but they seem exorbitant - $18 for a carafe of passion fruit mimosa. I like the crayons and paper table cloth vibe as well. Only thing preventing a higher rating - the food isn't spectacular flavor wise, more like standard diner fare, and the glasses/plates/silverware are all in bad shape, nothing to cause health concerns but definitely not "squeaky clean." I appreciate they are doing something unique and genuinely welcome for that specific strip of Polk. Definitely a solid option.
author: Max B.

description: Unfortunately they messed up my order twice.  I ordered the meat lovers omelet and the description said it came with bacon, sausage, steak, mozzarella cheese, onions and mushrooms.  Since I avoid almost all vegetables I asked for no onions or mushrooms.  When it came, there were no onions or mushrooms, but for some reason they put a lot of tomatoes in there.  I sent it back and explained that the menu said nothing about tomatoes or I would have said that as well.  The brought me a new one but this time there was no steak.  Only bacon and sausage.  In the first one I did notice there was a lot of steak in there.  I should have, but I didn't complain about this one since my friend was already almost finished with his meal.  While it was tasty, I sure did miss the steak.
author: Victor E.

description:
First off - this has nothing to do with Myconos/Mykonos, the restaurant this pop-up takes place in (which is excellent, efficient and affordable, BTW!).

Was excited to try a new breakfast/brunch place on Polk. I live nearby and am always glad for new options. I'm afraid I probably won't be back to this pop-up.
* 11:05am Saturday. Bit of a wait which is standard for Polk Street and vicinity; not much you can do about that but FYI (does not factor into my rating)
* Server guy just did not seem into helping our party of 5. We ordered 4 coffees. There was 1 single-serve container of cream available on table. Asked for more creamers. He only brought 2. Had to ask again for more cream, he seemed inconvenienced then came back and just kind of tossed a handful of the creamers at the corner of the table and walked away. He seemed to be inconvenienced by serving the table in general
* Waited 55 minutes to receive food from time we placed order; when food arrived all of it was generally cold - super bummer :(
* We could not eat our cold food because we had no silverware (maybe after 55 minutes of sitting without silverware and multiple trips to our table server guy might have noticed? Or noticed no silverware when brining the meals?). After several minutes of being unable to eat our meals, nor get his attention, I got up and went to the front to collect napkins (didn't have any of those either) and silverware for our party of 5
* I had the smoked salmon benedict which was fine, although cold as mentioned. Could be a bit more generous on the hollandaise in my opinion/for my tastes. (Why do restaurants seem to skimp on the hollandaise? It's the main attraction of the eggs benny. If they're trying to conserve, maybe they could just make more to being with?)
* I very much enjoy the hash browns instead of home fries! Long live hash browns!
* Total bill (without tip) for 5 entrees, 2 half-liters of mimosa and 4 coffees was approx. $75 which was obviously a great price. Perhaps they took something off the bill? The guy that runs this pop-up noticed I was grabbing my own silverware so perhaps that's the case and if so, the gesture is appreciated.

BTW he is the same guy that does New Village across the street. Very, very nice dude and creative with the themes and the ingredients - - but unfortunately runs two slow-service businesses. I was a bit apprehensive to dine here when I noticed him running the show upon arrival. Was hoping that with different cooks than at across the street it might be a more  efficient operation. Definitely plan on a long wait for food so don't arrive starving to death. Love to see them pick up the pace and give a bit more attention to the basics. They deserve to succeed and can - the brunch business on Polk is a goldmine! But a captive audience is no excuse for mediocre service.
author: Jen V.

description: Love their simple yet delicious menu! Grab spot for catching up over brunch with my girlfriends!
author: Kerry K.

description: Awesomer service by Ashley and Derek the owner was super friendly!  Food was delicious!
author: Courtney W.

description: Excellent food excellent service!!! The Margret Cho Fu was delicious tofu cooked to perfection. The staff is very courteous. The NanuNanu pancakes were not to sweet just right!!!
author: Rolando Junior M.

description: This is one of my favorite breakfast places in San Francisco. Being a pop up, after December I will need to find out it's next location.  I would recommend this to anyone that wants to experience a good breakfast.
author: Garrett C.

description: So glad my friends and I stumbled upon this pop-up a few weeks ago! They have themed brunch menus that change each weekend in addition to their standard brunch menu. Food was great and prices were reasonable. Also there was no line... unheard of in SF on a Sunday!
author: Rachel C.

description: The food is delicious. I liked my eggs a regular poach and my cousin wanted them a well done poach. Our waiter chris was kind,  funny l, and made sure we had a great breakfast. Love this place. Get the salazar
author: Yasmeen A.

description: Parfait was soggy granola and turned strawberries like they made it last night. They remade a fresh one and it was saturated in so much honey it was overbearing. Not to friendly either
author: Aliey H.

description: Derek and his team make you feel like you're visiting the diner in your hometown while also creating delicious, awesome and interesting brunches. A fast favorite and can't wait to go back. The Trivet with spicy hollandaise, crawfish, bacon and spinach is pretty much perfect and the macaroni and cheese is one of the best.
author: Drew H.

description: The name and good reviews (4.5 stars on yelp) enticed us in, but the food was meh. There were two or three tables full when we arrived, but our food still came out on the cold side. The bacon was WELL undercooked and omelette I ordered was generally bland. I would not return.
author: Aimee M.

description: Just devastated by the shockingly poor quality of the coffee & breakfast I was just served - almost all of which I left on the plate in disgust as I left. Would strongly urge you to consider another - any other - option for breakfast/brunch. For context, I ordered a scramble and a cup of coffee - the scramble was runny, the component meats undercooked and the cold cheese added as a garnish on top barely melted and only served to chill down the plate. The side "salad" (for which I paid extra) was a handful of unseasoned spinach served with huge chunks of raw red onion and a half-ramekin of goopy factory bought dressing. The lingering acridity of their house coffee haunts me even as I write this - if I had to take a wild guess, I'd say "day old partially evaporated coffee, reheated the next day and cut with equal parts hot water and quaternary ammonia". Personally, I plan to never return and - uncharastically - felt so strongly about my experience that that I needed to write this warning to prospective diners.
author: Bernard F.

description: Gosh this place has excellent food the Trivet benedict with bacon and crawfish is off the chain. I came in minutes before they close and they accommodated me and I'm so glad they did.
author: N A.

description: First off, the name is adorable! Secondly, they are definitely worthy of the name because the benedicts were delicious! I orders the Trivets, which came with crawfish tails. It was nice to have the mix of a "typical" eggs benedict with bacon and spinach and have some crawfish tails on the side. Hash brown potatoes were pretty good as well although they could have been a little bit more crispy. The theme was superheroes the weekend we went and it was cute to see some of the waitstaff dressed up!
author: Dora T.

description: I am surprised by the 5 star reviews! Our food was cold and wasn't anything special. The food portions were small. Our meal was 16 each and I didn't see that it was worth it. My trivet Benedict crawfish tasted overly chewy. The waitress was "friendly" to many of the patrons but she made us wait 15 mins before getting a menu to look at. She did not apologize and it took a long time each time she left our table. She was busy talking to everyone and would not come by our table. Will not go back. Food is not special
author: Diana L.

description: Best service and food! I'm definitely coming back here. We had a party of 10 and they were so accommodating. I got the Boulder omelet and it was to die for.
author: Ashley T.

description: Friendly staff but mediocre service.  They were a bit disorganized.  I ordered the florentina Benedict and it was so tasty.  The beet sauce was what sold me.  They did forget to bring my toast and when I reminded them they brought me untoasted bread....lazy.
author: Young-Ju O.

description: Yum! We were here on their opening day and they were able to accommodate 14 of us! We had lots of fun doodling with crayons on their paper tablecloths, and the food was delicious. I ordered the croque devino - the brioche was moist and fluffy and the hollandaise was flavorful. We would definitely come back!
author: Kim M.

description: The Food and Service was awesome!!!  In town visiting and found this restaurant  on Yelp.  So glad we did.  Portions were  perfect.  My picky 14 year old cleaned his plate.  We were given complimentary cookies as we paid our bill.
author: Eric L.

description: These guys know how to do it. Best brunch in town hands down. The service is top notch. Chris will get you anything you need. He's great with the jokes too. You should also check there drink menu. If you like mimosas then this is your place. The food is excellent and well prepared. The eggs on the Benedict are always cooked perfectly. These guys totally deserve 10 stars.
author: Lenny S.

description:
So, I was in the area and I thought I'd try it out. It was kinda a little hard to find, but that's because we weren't expecting to find it hiding in a little Greek place. It's​ a pretty cool place, with a really chill atmosphere. The waitstaff is kinda quirky, but overall pretty nice.

For food, we ordered a French toast and an original Benedict. The french toast wasn't anything special, but the Benedict was really good. Like, really good. The food came out quickly, so that was a plus too.

Overall, it was a solid meal in a pretty cool place. I'd definitely recommend hitting it if you're in the area.
author: Samuel O.

description: Bangin scrambles and really fun brunch mimosa and themed food menu!!! SOOO good, plus the coffee is strong too
author: Rachel P.

description: I woke up starving after a long haul flight from Europe. These guys were a lifesaver. Steak and eggs filled me up. The coffee refills got me going but not nearly as much as the Foreigner blasting on the stereo. Thanks guys. The name slays me.
author: Brad M.

description: this place is great, went during the GOT theme and it was outstanding.  Great food, service and reasonably priced.
author: Robert S.

description: My absolute favorite brunch in SF!! The food is perfection and the service is truly stellar -- I would suggest this spot to anyone !
author: Noel Z.

description: Not a great atmosphere but great food! Love the themed brunch idea just wish the atmosphere was a little more lively for a brunch spot.
author: Bonnie S.

description: fthis place is awesome i have been here two weekends in a row the first week i had the Death Star Croque, there themed brunches are awesome there creative and tastey. if you like breakfast and a cozy homey feel this is the place. parking is a little tough it is in the city but worth it im coming back again
author: Benjie S.

description: Great spot for a fun, unique, diner-style brunch. Fabulous people, great food & drinks, super-friendly staff, and not super-expensive. Their themes are always fun and creative, and their "regular" food is tasty too. If you're looking for a go-to neighborhood spot with a fun twist so you're not always ordering the same thing, you've found it! If you're looking for over-priced with fancy decor, head somewhere else & let the rest of us enjoy this spot without you. ;-)
author: Maia W.

description: I had such high hopes for this place but it was a bit disappointing.  The drinks sounded amazing but were a let down.  The food was pretty average.  The service was great and the place had a very fun, laid back vibe.
author: Cari N.

description: This was outstanding.  I'm a bene fan but usually find it hard to deviate from the traditional.  Today, I tried the wild salmon bene and it was fabulous!  It comes with cream cheese, tomato, spinach, capers, delicious salmon (and a lot of it), eggs and fabulous hollandaise. The friendly staff complemented the meal.
author: J. D.

description: Best brunch of my life! The service was spectacular! Owner came over and introduced himself personally. Can't wait to come back.
author: Lily P.

description: This place is fantastic! I had my grandfathers birthday brunch here and he loved it!  They text you a couple days before asking if you have any special requests or favorite foods they can provide for you.  Unfortunately my grandfather doesn't have anything specific that he loves, so they brought out pancakes for him with candles on them.   They also provided a happy birthday banner with little birthday hats on the table for each person. They even gave him a happy birthday card with everyone's signature on it.  Super cute. Everyone there was very friendly and the food was amazing!
author: Ashley O.

description: First place me and my boyfriend ate while visiting San Francisco. Cozy little place, quick seating and a very friendly staff. Food was out quick and very delicious. Our server was very attentive and made the experience great. Definitely recommend this place, you'll enjoy it!!
author: Jess M.

description: We stopped by here on a Tuesday morning and had the most amazing eggs benedict. I had the classic while my husband tried the Salazar. The Hollandaise sauce is perfection! The food quality was amazing, and the service was wonderful as well. Definitely a must try for breakfast or brunch!
author: Kylie G.

description: It doesn't get more San Francisco than this! The food is unbelievable, the service is amazing and the location is on target. Definitely coming back
author: Eloisa B.

description: So happy to hear the ownership from new village is still around! This place is awesome, great food, great mimosas and wonderful service!
author: Jennifer B.

description: What a great spot!! This place has it all, great food, good bellinis, impeccable service and they also provide crayons to keep you entertained as you wait for your food. To top it off they played really fun music :) I highly recommend friends with Benedicts, what a lovely new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Rachel E.

description: This my first yelp review because I had to report what a wonderful experience it was to eat at this delightful pop up! The style, service and food are top notch. I came in on crutches and they offered me a discount which was very sweet. Every staff member was extremely friendly and helpful. They even have crayons and you can color or play hangman while you wait. The salmon Benedict was amazing and so were the blueberry pie pancakes. I hope this pop up stays forever and will definitely be back!
author: Kimberly S.

description: Best brunch with quality ingredients, cute atmosphere, and loveable staff! The owner and staff have worked together for ages and it shows! I moved to Nob Hill and searched far and wide for many months for a go to breakfast / brunch spot and this group has nailed its place at #1 go to spot.
author: Jason S.
